titles.title: SF349 I am not skilled to understand

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
1 I am not skilled to understand
what God has willed, what God has planned;
I only know at his right hand
stands one who is my Saviour.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
2 I take him at his word and deed:
Christ died to save me; this I read
and in my heart I find a need
of him to be my Saviour.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
3.That he would leave his place on high
and come for sinners once to die -
you count it strange? So once did I,
before I knew my Saviour

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
4 Yes, living, dying, let me bring
my strength, my solace from this spring;
that he who lives to be my King
once died to be my Saviour

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
5 That he would leave his place on high
and come for sinners once to die -
you count it strange? So once did I,
before I knew my Saviour
Dorothy Greenwell (1821-1882) (alt.) and Aaron Shust
